p.s: In the following I am going to analyze how Starr's state of mind is presented and how point of view and other narrative techniques add to this effect.
Because this scene is written in I sentence construction and relies on the first personfirst-person pronouns, I can conclude that it's written in first personfirst-person point of view.
The first personfirst-person point of view helps the reader to have a deeper look into a character's mind and achieves intimacy.
The disadvantage of the first personfirst-person point of view is that the readersreaders' view is limited because of the ability of the character.
Only seeing Starr's point of view and her opinions creates authenticity in the minds of the reader.
When Starr says the opposite of what she tinksthinks, only the reader and her can see what is truly going on in her mind, it's the same with her emotions.
When she feels something the person she is talking to has no chance to recognize her feelings, but the reader does.
